title: CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation)
description: Emergency procedure for someone who has stopped breathing or whose heart has stopped.
steps: Check the scene for safety.
Check for responsiveness. Tap the shoulder and shout 'Are you okay?'
Call 911 or local emergency number.
Check for breathing. If not breathing, start CPR.
Push hard and fast in the center of the chest (100-120 compressions per minute).
Give rescue breaths if trained (2 breaths after 30 compressions).

title: Burns
description: Immediate care for heat, chemical, or electrical burns.
steps: Cool the burn with cool (not cold) running water for at least 10 minutes.
Remove tight items (rings, watches) from the burned area before swelling starts.
Cover the burn with a sterile, non-stick bandage.
Do not pop blisters.
Take pain reliever if necessary.
Seek medical attention for severe burns.

title: Severe Bleeding
steps: Apply direct pressure on the wound with a clean cloth or bandage.
Maintain pressure until bleeding stops.
Do not remove the cloth if it soaks through; add more layers on top.
Elevate the wound above the heart if possible.
Wash hands after providing care.

title: Choking
description: Heimlich maneuver for a choking adult or child.
steps: Stand behind the person and wrap your arms around their waist.
Make a fist with one hand.
Place the thumb side of your fist against the person's abdomen, just above the navel.
Grasp your fist with your other hand and press hard into the abdomen with a quick, upward thrust.
Repeat until the object is expelled.
